quote: A heap of epithets is poor praise: the praise lies in the facts, and in the way of telling them.
A man is never more serious than when he praise himself.
A negative judgment gives you more satisfaction than praise, provided it smacks of jealousy.
A new philosophy generally means in practice the praise of some old vice.
A person places themselves on a level with the ones they praise.
Admonish your friends privately, but praise them openly.
An ingenuous mind feels in unmerited praise the bitterest reproof.
Attach yourself to those who advise you rather than praise you.
Call the bald man, ''Boy;'' make the sage thy toy; greet the youth with solemn face; praise the fat man for his grace.
Classic. A book which people praise and don't read.
Envy is a kind of praise.
Eulogy. Praise of a person who has either the advantages of wealth and power, or the consideration to be dead.
A heap of epithets is poor praise: the praise lies in the facts, and in the way of telling them.
A man is never more serious than when he praise himself.
A negative judgment gives you more satisfaction than praise, provided it smacks of jealousy.
A new philosophy generally means in practice the praise of some old vice.
A person places themselves on a level with the ones they praise.
Admonish your friends privately, but praise them openly.
An ingenuous mind feels in unmerited praise the bitterest reproof.
Attach yourself to those who advise you rather than praise you.
Call the bald man, ''Boy;'' make the sage thy toy; greet the youth with solemn face; praise the fat man for his grace.
Classic. A book which people praise and don't read.
Envy is a kind of praise.
Eulogy. Praise of a person who has either the advantages of wealth and power, or the consideration to be dead.
Every formula which expresses a law of nature is a hymn of praise to God.
Few persons have sufficient wisdom to prefer censure, which is useful, to praise which deceives them.
Fondly we think we honor merit then, When we but praise ourselves in other men.
Fools may our scorn, not envy, raise. For envy is a kind of praise.
For we which now behold these present days have eyes to wonder, but lack tongues to praise.
Forbear to mention what thou canst not praise.
God made man merely to hear some praise of what he'd done on those Five Days.
He that does good for good's sake seeks neither praise nor reward, though sure of both at last.
I do not speak of what I cannot praise.
I don't judge a regime by the damning criticism of the opposition, but by the ingenuous praise of the partisan.
I find the pain of a little censure, even when it is unfounded, is more acute than the pleasure of much praise.
I know of no manner of speaking so offensive as that of giving praise, and closing it with an exception.
I love criticism just so long as it's unqualified praise.
I will praise any man that will praise me.
In my writing, as much as I could, I tried to find the good, and praise it.
It is a sign of a creeping inner death when we no longer can praise the living.
It is as hard to satirize well a man of distinguished vices, as to praise well a man of distinguished virtues.
It is salutary to train oneself to be no more affected by censure than by praise.
It is simpler and easier to flatter people than to praise them.
It is wonderful to have someone praise you, to be desired.
Just praise is only a debt, but flattery is a present.
Many know how to flatter, few know how to praise.
Modesty and unselfishness - these are the virtues which men praise - and pass by.
Modesty and unselfishness - these are the virtues which men praise - and pass by.
Modesty is the only sure bait when you angle for praise.
Never praise a sister to a sister in the hope of your compliments reaching he proper ears.
One should use praise to recognize what one is not.
Our high respect for a well read person is praise enough for literature.
People ask for criticism, but they only want praise.
People ask you for criticism, but they only want praise.
People who ask for your criticism want only praise.
Praise from an enemy is the most pleasing of all commendations.
Praise from the common people is generally false, and rather follows the vain that the virtuous.
Praise God even when you don't understand what He is doing.
Praise out of season, or tactlessly bestowed, can freeze the heart as much as blame.
Praise the sea; on shore remain.
Praise those of your critics for whom nothing is up to standard.
Praise undeserved, is satire in disguise.
Praise, like gold and diamonds, owes its value only to its scarcity.
Real joy comes not from ease or riches or from the praise of men, but from doing something worthwhile.
Reprove your friends in secret, praise them openly.
Such is the love of praise, so great the anxiety for victory.
Sure of their qualities and demanding praise, more go to ruined fortunes than are raised.
Sweet is the scene where genial friendship plays the pleasing game of interchanging praise.
The highest panegyric, therefore, that private virtue can receive, is the praise of servants.
The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
The only way to escape the personal corruption of praise is to go on working.
The praise that comes from love does not make us vain, but more humble.
The sad souls of those who lived without blame and without praise.
The trouble with most of us is that we would rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.
The way of the world is, to praise dead saints, and persecute living ones.
Their silence is praise enough.
There are two things people want more than sex and money... recognition and praise.
There is no belittling worse than to over praise a man.
There is no praise to beat the sort you can put in your pocket.
There's not one wise man among twenty will praise himself.
They are good furniture pictures, unworthy of praise, and undeserving of blame.
Think not those faithful who praise all thy words and actions, but those who kindly reprove thy faults.
This miserable state is borne by the wretched souls of those who lived without disgrace and without praise.
Unless a reviewer has the courage to give you unqualified praise, I say ignore the bastard.
Usually we praise only to be praised.
We are apt to love praise, but not deserve it. But if we would deserve it, we must love virtue more than that.
We increase whatever we praise. The whole creation responds to praise, and is glad.
When a man wants your advice he generally wants your praise.
When I make a feast I would my guests should praise it, not the cooks.
When we disclaim praise, it is only showing our desire to be praised a second time.
You can tell the character of every man when you see how he receives praise.
A refusal of praise is a desire to be praised twice.
Praise invariably implies a reference to a higher standard.
